page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: CIVIL AIRPORT.."MARSHALLS" PAGE 1 continued From Marshalls airport, Premier Airlines operate a thrice weekly service to the Channel Islands. A charter service also operates by the 'Midas' company. Because of its nearness to Newmarket the airport specialises in ferrying racehorses to all parts of the world, and even has its own stables at the airport. In 1954 the Marshall Group had to build a 6000 feet new runway to accommodate the large jet planes and in 1984 had to build two vast hangars which can house 5 large jet liners which come in for modifications.
